definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Were you aware he was ball-deep in some Washington wonk ?
sentences.chinese: 你知道他和華盛頓的一個書呆子有染嗎？

sentences.english: The egghead in the university knows nothing about business.
sentences.chinese: 大學裏的書呆子對生意一竅不通。

sentences.english: But self-described nerd Kenta Asata, said the wait was worth it.
sentences.chinese: 但是，自描述的書呆子健太朝多說，等待是值得的。

sentences.english: In spite of her love of reading she denied being an egghead .
sentences.chinese: 儘管她愛好閱讀，但她不認爲自己是個書呆子。

sentences.english: Michael Lopp: Nerds are system thinkers.
sentences.chinese: 書呆子們就是系統思考者。

sentences.english: It filled my nerdy side with joy, and I downloaded all of the issues.
sentences.chinese: 這太讓我這個書呆子高興了，我把每期都下載了下來。

sentences.english: Be nice to nerds . Chances are you'll end up working for one.
sentences.chinese: 成爲書呆子很好，機遇以你爲什麼工作的方式而告終。

sentences.english: I can't date a dork like him!
sentences.chinese: 我不會跟像他這樣的書呆子約會。

sentences.english: That’s how a nerd copes with first-date anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 這就是書呆子應對第一次約會的方法。

sentences.english: Last, nerds are  more powerful than we know.
sentences.chinese: 最後，書呆子是比我們想象中更強大。

sentences.english: For example: John is such an egghead, he should get out more and enjoy himself。
sentences.chinese: 約翰都快成書呆子了，他應該多出去轉轉，放鬆一下。

sentences.english: Also, nerds get a high out of building stuff.
sentences.chinese: 書呆子們在建設某種東西的過程中自得其樂。

sentences.english: Bookish bachelor seeking single Noetic Scientist?
sentences.chinese: 書呆子單身漢在追求單身的抽象的科學家？

sentences.english: Go to the library on weekends? You are a certifiable bookworm.
sentences.chinese: 週末還去圖書館？你真是一個無可救藥的書呆子。

sentences.english: I picked "nerd" as the word years ago to describe this demographic.
sentences.chinese: 我幾年前用“書呆子”這個詞來描述這類人羣。

sentences.english: But the boys in our class are too ugly, and are all bookworms.
sentences.chinese: 但是我們班的男生太醜了，都是書呆子。

definition: see 驢唇不對馬嘴|驴唇不对马嘴[lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3]
pinyin: niu2 tou2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3

definition: lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
not one good point/everything about it is wrong
to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
happy to partake but not prepared to do any work (idiom)/all take and no give
indirect, psychological method of getting sb to do as one wishes (e.g. questioning whether they are up to the task)
